channel.title: CyberNetSec - Latest Cybersecurity Articles
channel.description: Latest cybersecurity threat intelligence articles from the past 3 days

item.title: New "Benzona" Ransomware Strain Discovered in the Wild
item.description:
Security researchers at CYFIRMA have discovered a new ransomware strain named "Benzona." The malware encrypts files on Windows, macOS, and Linux systems, appending a ".benzona" extension and dropping a ransom note titled "RECOVERY_INFO.txt". Victims are instructed to use the TOR browser to access a ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Ransomware, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical 7-Zip RCE Vulnerability Now Under Active Exploitation
item.description:
A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in the popular 7-Zip file archiver, tracked as CVE-2025-11001, is now being actively exploited in the wild. The path traversal flaw, which affects versions prior to 25.0.0, can be triggered when a user extracts a specially crafted malicious archiv...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Exposes 'BRICKSTORM' Backdoor Used by Chinese State Actors to Infiltrate US Government
item.description:
The US Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), NSA, and Canadian Centre for Cyber Security have jointly exposed a sophisticated backdoor named 'BRICKSTORM'. According to the December 4, 2025 advisory, People's Republic of China (PRC) state-sponsored actors are using this malware to ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Payments Exceed $2.1 Billion Since 2022, FinCEN Reports
item.description:
A new Financial Trend Analysis from the U.S. Treasury's Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN), released December 4, 2025, reveals that financial institutions reported over $2.1 billion in ransomware-related payments between January 2022 and December 2024. The data, derived from Bank Secrecy ...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Ransomware, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Freedom Mobile Data Breach Exposes Customer PII via Compromised Subcontractor
item.description:
Canadian telecommunications provider Freedom Mobile announced on December 3, 2025, that it suffered a data breach after an unauthorized party gained access to its systems on October 23, 2025. The attacker leveraged the compromised account of a third-party subcontractor to access a customer account m...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Phishing

item.title: CISA KEV Alert: Actively Exploited ScadaBR Flaw Puts Industrial Control Systems at Risk
item.description:
CISA has added CVE-2021-26828, a high-severity vulnerability in the OpenPLC ScadaBR industrial control system (ICS) software, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog as of December 3, 2025. The flaw, with a CVSS score of 8.7, is an unrestricted file upload vulnerability that allows an a...

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Under Armour Sued Over Data Breach Attributed to 'Everest' Cybercrime Group
item.description:
Athletic apparel giant Under Armour is the target of a new class action lawsuit following a November 2025 data breach. The suit, reported on December 4, 2025, claims the company was negligent in protecting the personal information of consumers and employees. The breach was allegedly carried out by t...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical Zero-Days in PyTorch Scanner 'PickleScan' Create AI Supply Chain Risk
item.description:
Security firm JFrog has disclosed three critical zero-day vulnerabilities in PickleScan, a popular open-source tool used to scan Python pickle files for malware, particularly within the PyTorch AI framework. The flaws, collectively rated with a CVSS score of 9.3, allow an attacker to craft a malicio...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Supply Chain Attack, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: AWS Boosts Cloud Defense with New AI-Powered Security Tools at re:Invent 2025
item.description:
At its re:Invent 2025 conference, Amazon Web Services (AWS) unveiled several major additions to its security portfolio, heavily infused with artificial intelligence. Key announcements on December 3, 2025, included the preview of AWS Security Agent, a context-aware tool for proactive application secu...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Cloud Security, Security Operations, Patch Management

item.title: React2Shell: Critical 10.0 CVSS RCE Hits React & Next.js, Actively Exploited!
item.description:
A critical unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, dubbed 'React2Shell' and tracked as CVE-2025-55182, has been disclosed in React Server Components. With a maximum CVSS score of 10.0, the flaw affects popular frameworks like Next.js and allows attackers to take complete control o...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: ValleyRAT Malware Targets Job Seekers Using Foxit PDF Reader Disguise
item.description:
A new malware campaign is distributing the ValleyRAT remote access trojan by preying on job seekers. Attackers send emails with weaponized executables disguised as HR documents, using the Foxit PDF Reader icon as a lure. The attack leverages a legitimate, renamed Foxit executable to perform a DLL si...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: G7 Unveils New Framework for Coordinated Cyber Response in Financial Sector
item.description:
The G7 Cyber Expert Group has published a new policy paper outlining non-binding principles for Collective Cyber Incident Response and Recovery (CCIRR) within the global financial sector. The framework, developed to foster greater cross-border cooperation, aims to improve information sharing, stream...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Incident Response

item.title: EU Cyber Resilience Act Deadlines Loom: Vulnerability Reporting Starts 2026
item.description:
The European Union is advancing the implementation of its landmark Cyber Resilience Act (CRA), which establishes mandatory cybersecurity requirements for all hardware and software products sold in the EU. With the regulation now in force, key deadlines are approaching. Manufacturers must prepare for...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Vulnerability

item.title: SmartTube App Compromised: Malicious Update Pushed via Stolen Keys
item.description:
A significant supply chain attack has compromised the popular ad-free YouTube client for Android TV, SmartTube. An attacker stole the developer's signing keys and distributed a malicious update containing surveillance-style malware through official channels. The malware, hidden in versions 30.43 thr...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: 'Cryptomixer' Shut Down: Authorities Seize €25M in Bitcoin from Laundering Service
item.description:
A coordinated international law enforcement action, codenamed "Operation Olympia," has successfully dismantled Cryptomixer.io, a major cryptocurrency mixing service. Led by Swiss and German authorities with significant support from Europol and Eurojust, the takedown resulted in the seizure of server...

Severity: High

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Cyberattack, Threat Actor

item.title: Iran-Linked MuddyWater APT Targets Israel with New 'MuddyViper' Backdoor
item.description:
The Iranian-affiliated APT group MuddyWater has been observed in a new cyberespionage campaign targeting critical infrastructure and other key sectors in Israel and Egypt. Active from late 2024 to early 2025, the campaign leverages a previously undocumented custom C/C++ backdoor named MuddyViper. Th...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Lazarus APT's Remote IT Worker Infiltration Scheme Exposed in Real-Time
item.description:
A joint investigation by security researchers has exposed the inner workings of a North Korean Lazarus Group scheme where operatives commit identity fraud to get hired as remote IT workers at Western firms. By luring the threat actors into a sophisticated honeypot environment, researchers from BCA L...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Security Operations

item.title: India Backs Down on Mandatory Pre-Installed Government "Snooping App"
item.description:
Following widespread criticism from privacy advocates and significant resistance from major tech companies, the Indian government has withdrawn a controversial directive that would have required smartphone makers like Apple and Samsung to pre-install a non-deletable, state-owned security app. The ap...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Mobile Security

item.title: AI Cybersecurity Firm Tenex Expands to EMEA with New Funding
item.description:
AI-native cybersecurity firm Tenex announced its expansion into the Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) region on December 2, 2025. The strategic move is supported by a new Series A investment from the global investment firm DTCP. Tenex, which offers an AI-driven managed detection and response (M...

item.title: CrowdStrike Named AWS Global Security and Marketplace Partner of the Year
item.description:
At the AWS re:Invent 2025 conference, cybersecurity leader CrowdStrike was named both the Amazon Web Services (AWS) 2025 Global Security Partner of the Year and the Global Marketplace Partner of the Year.
